docs.abstract: Even if you do not have Google Photos set to back up every picture automatically, you can upload selected images for your friends to see.
docs.snippet: Even if you do not have Google Photos set to back up every picture automatically, you can upload selected images for your friends to see.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. A previous column explained how to download specific files from Google Photos, but I need to know how to upload a specific album to share with a family group. How do I do this?

headline.main: Sharing Online Albums With Google Photos

docs.abstract: Apple’s voice-activated software assistant can now stream an up-to-date audio newscast on command.
docs.snippet: Apple’s voice-activated software assistant can now stream an up-to-date audio newscast on command.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. On my Amazon Echo at home, I can ask “What’s new?” and get a briefing from sources I’ve selected for news, business, sports and so on. Is there anything similar to that for an iPhone so I can get this type of information read to me while I’m in the car?

headline.main: Asking Siri to Play a Newscast

docs.abstract: Once you find them, you can follow people, places and things on the visual social network.
docs.snippet: Once you find them, you can follow people, places and things on the visual social network.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. I’m new to Instagram. Aside from the service suggesting Facebook friends who also have Instagram accounts, how do I find new people to follow?

docs.abstract: You can add descriptions to the pictures in your online Google Photo albums from a mobile device or desktop browser.
docs.snippet: You can add descriptions to the pictures in your online Google Photo albums from a mobile device or desktop browser.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. On Android, how do I add caption information to individual pictures I have stored online in a Google Photos album? The text edit tool in the Google Photos Help guide seems to just add a caption on the whole album.

headline.main: Adding Captions to Images in Google Photos

docs.abstract: At a solar farm in North Carolina, workers are bracing for the effect of a new tariff on imported solar cells and modules.
docs.snippet: At a solar farm in North Carolina, workers are bracing for the effect of a new tariff on imported solar cells and modules.
docs.lead_paragraph: ZEBULON, N.C. — At this century-old farm just outside Durham, symmetrical rows of shining blue solar panels have replaced the soybeans and tobacco that Tommy Vinson and his family used to grow here. It is one of many solar farms that have sprung up around North Carolina, transforming a state long battered by global offshoring into the second-largest generator of solar electricity after California.

headline.main: Trump’s Solar Tariffs Are Clouding the Industry’s Future
headline.print_headline: Steep Tariffs Threaten Growth of Solar Industry

byline.original: By Ana Swanson and Brad Plumer

docs.abstract: Apple says its tablets did not get the same “power management” software that slowed down many iPhone models so iPads do not get the battery discount.
docs.snippet: Apple says its tablets did not get the same “power management” software that slowed down many iPhone models so iPads do not get the battery discount.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. Is Apple also slowing down older iPads? If so, will it replace batteries at a reduced rate?

docs.abstract: A few free apps can earn you a few bucks as long as you know what you’re getting into. They won’t fund your retirement, but they’ll help you pay for that latte.
docs.snippet: A few free apps can earn you a few bucks as long as you know what you’re getting into. They won’t fund your retirement, but they’ll help you pay for that latte.
docs.lead_paragraph: Let’s say you want to earn some extra pocket cash, but you’re short on free time (and energy). Your phone might be a good place to start. There are quite a few apps designed to help you earn some extra dough, either in the form of gift cards or standard cold, hard cash.

headline.main: 4 Free Apps That Can Earn You Extra Cash
headline.print_headline: Some Free Apps to Help  You Pay for That Latte

docs.abstract: Some Facebook executives still seem more interested in defending themselves from criticism than owning their mistakes related to the 2016 election.
docs.snippet: Some Facebook executives still seem more interested in defending themselves from criticism than owning their mistakes related to the 2016 election.
docs.lead_paragraph: On most days, Facebook doesn’t have much in common with President Trump. But at the moment, both are in the damage-control business, as they try to get out from under the cloud of suspicion related to Russia’s meddling in the 2016 election.

headline.main: On Russia, Facebook Sends a Message It Wishes It Hadn’t
headline.print_headline: On Russian Meddling, Some Facebook Leaders Are in Denial

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: Foreign countries are responding to tariffs imposed on solar panels and washing machines with challenges in American courts and at the World Trade Organization.
docs.snippet: Foreign countries are responding to tariffs imposed on solar panels and washing machines with challenges in American courts and at the World Trade Organization.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Tariffs imposed by the United States late last month are prompting a wave of litigation from other nations, including Canada and China, escalating concerns that the Trump administration’s more aggressive trade stance could worsen international relations and spur retaliatory actions on American goods sent abroad.

headline.main: Trump Trade Measures Set Off a Global Legal Pushback
headline.print_headline: Countries Fight Back Against Trump Trade Measures

docs.abstract: Programs battling for resources, damaged driver software and other issues can drag down Windows 10 when it starts up.
docs.snippet: Programs battling for resources, damaged driver software and other issues can drag down Windows 10 when it starts up.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. There appears to be a problem with Windows 10. At start-up, the drive use is at 100 percent. It can be impossible to open email or a browser or anything else for 15 to 30 minutes, sometimes even longer. What’s going on?
